summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons investigative report concerning an incident on July 23, 2019, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with a homemade noose around his neck in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The report details the incident, medical findings, and interviews with Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, concluding there was insufficient evidence of an assault and no need for a separation order.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the report, found with a homemade noose around his neck in his cell. He was interviewed and claimed the incident was not a suicide attempt and that he had no issues with his cellmate.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident. He was interviewed and stated he discovered Epstein on the floor, thought he was having a heart attack, and reported that Epstein made uncomfortable comments about the age of consent.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York. Both were interviewed separately about the incident involving Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Found with Homemade Noose
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on his cell floor in a fetal position with a homemade fashioned noose around his neck. He was breathing heavily and responsive. He was restrained, medically examined, and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Interview of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Epstein was interviewed by SIS staff. He stated he was extremely tired, got up for water, and only recalled being on the floor snoring. He claimed no issues with cellmate Tartaglione, who had previously called him a 'pedophile'. Epstein denied being suicidal.

events.title: Interview of Nicholas Tartaglione
events.description: Tartaglione was interviewed. He stated he was asleep on the floor when he felt something hit his foot, found Epstein sitting with eyes open, and called for help. He reported Epstein made him uncomfortable by stating 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states'.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: An Administrative Detention Order was issued, placing Jeffrey Epstein in Administrative Detention pending classification.

locations: New York MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York
Receiving and Discharge Area at MCC New York
Health Services Area at MCC New York
keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell with a homemade noose around his neck, resulting in visible neck injuries documented in a medical assessment.
Epstein's cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, reported that Epstein had made a statement to him that 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states and I don't understand what's the problem here'.
The Bureau of Prisons investigation concluded there was insufficient evidence to support that Epstein was assaulted by Tartaglione and recommended no separation order was warranted.
Epstein, during his interview, denied being suicidal, claimed extreme fatigue, and stated he felt safe with Tartaglione despite the latter having previously called him a 'pedophile'.
The document is an official BOP investigative report dated August 2, 2019, detailing an incident that occurred weeks before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
